entity.name: GNU Radio
entity.description: Free and Open Source software-defined radio ecosystem, allowing radio signal processing on any modern computer.

projects.name: GNU Radio
projects.description: Software-defined radio signal processing framework, providing data marshalling, and a large library of existing blocks for signal processing steps in data flowgraphs.

projects.name: Vector-Optimized Library of Kernels
projects.description: VOLK provides uniform C and C++ abstractions for hand-optimized SIMD kernels for common numerical tasks with vector data.

projects.name: SigMF: the Signal Metadata Format
projects.description: SigMF is a commonly used format in which RF recordings can be interoperably exchanged.

channels.description: Donation through the SETI Institute's infrastructure
Contact the board for bank account information to use for donations
Support GNU Radio by buying a supporter ticket for the annual GNU Radio conferences

plans.name: One-time donation
plans.description: Donate to GNU Radio on a monthly basis

plans.name: Supporter Tickets
plans.description: GNU Radio organizes the annual GNU Radio conference. Support GNU Radio by buying patron-level attendance tickets or by paying as much as you'd like for the live video stream
